result.execSummary:
The defendant Elliot T Oshkeshequoam was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
STAYED.
Standard release conditions.
13 days credit, if revoked.
Probation may be transferred to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
Provide DNA sample if not already done.
No contact with the victim.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Elliot T Oshkeshequoam

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: 10/28/15
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to have no contact with Pick N Save on Greenfield Ave in the City of Brookfield listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant Elliot T Oshkeshequoam in court, in custody, with attorney Adam J. Schleis.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: August 3, 2015
Attorney Adam J. Schleis in court.   Defendant Elliot T Oshkeshequoam did not appear.   Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to have no contact with Pick N Save on Greenfield Ave in the City of Brookfield listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant Elliot T Oshkeshequoam in court, in custody, with attorney Nicole M Masnica.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
